alert.note: Alert for Archer; Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 4:51AM CDT until July 09 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jefferson County in southern Oklahoma... Northwestern Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southern Stephens County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Cotton County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Clay County in northern Texas... Northeastern Archer County in northern Texas... Wichita County in northern Texas... * Until 530 AM CDT. * At 449 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Loco to 5 miles west of Iowa Park, moving east at 45 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR Wichita Falls, Henrietta, Ryan, and Waurika. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management reported 76 mph wind gust in Wichita Falls. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Henrietta, Waurika, Iowa Park, Healdton, Holliday, Wilson, Comanche, Ringling, Temple, Ryan, Petrolia, Scotland, Byers, Dean, Windthorst, Terral, Bellevue, and Jolly. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
